title: Bug 113047 - No child node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no child node listing. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page and change the data source. 3. The new data source does not have any database/table/column information. Actual result: There is no child node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
SR: Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page and change the data source. 3. The new data source does not have any database/table/column information. Expected result: When changing the data source, the data set editor should display a child node listing. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
